title: Honestly, this "tank assassin" that's been going on for a while now needs to end.
body: Seriously, now that tank ekko is making another round again and the rise with tank yasuo this shit needs to end or it will basically be the norm now.

replies.body: the problem is people need to be tanky to not die in .5 seconds to adc's

Oh, and assassins scaling with kills is considered feast or famine and antifun. That too.

Adcs killing minions for twenty-thirty minutes before steamrolling everyone is interesting, however.

Exactly.

I always prefer to play glass cannon Fiora, but damage is just so high right now that I do better with more durable bruiser builds. I just accept that the AD scaling on my Vital mark passive goes largely to waste since I'd rather live long enough to proc multiple Vitals and survive the fight than proc 1 Vital for a big burst then die instantly. 

As long as you have the durability to survive in a fight, then sustained Triforce proc's and Fervor of Battle keystone can be relied on to win eventually.

I blame Marksmen having powerful, ranged AD-scaling abilities in addition to easily getting 70%+ Crit Chance if they want to. If they stack AD and Armor Pen then they become ranged assassins - which are clearly better and safer than melee assassins since they can just back off whether they get a kill or not. If they get AD/Crit/Attack Speed then they deal as much damage as an assassin's entire rotation every second with targeted auto-attacks that have no resource cost, no real counterplay, proc lifesteal, and can easily hit twice a second.

When my targets are that powerful and can instantly delete me if I *don't* delete them in under 1 second...can you really blame me for wanting a tankier build to at least get to play the game?
I too am a Fiora main, I agree, but do you really build Triforce? That's only good when you're ahead. If you are slightly behind and having AD issues then Iceborn is much better.

Well yeah, if I do fall behind then I'll buy cheaper items and focus on tankiness to at least try and not feed the enemy while aiming to get off a group heal with my ult if possible.

Iceborn is super good on Fiora in general and sometimes I get it even when I'm ahead just for that sweet AoE slow on every Q.

Turns out {{item:3078}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3022}} can be really strong on Fiora if you can manage it. Not nearly as much damage as straight AD Fiora, but passable and way easier to survive a fight with.

Well said
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

This is what a lot of people fail to realise. Champions have to build tankier because there's so much more damage in the game this season. I mean TLD is +200 damage, fervor is +100 per auto, and so on while the resolve tree got _worse_ since last season!

I'd look at it differently:  if you get that free damage, you now have less incentive to build additional damage and would rather build tanky.  

In any case, I think you're 100% right to point the finger at keystones, and I sincerely hope Riot changes them from flat(ish) bonuses to ones that require and reward investment.  Make it a % increase to damage rather than flat, so you actually need to build damage to get damage out.  And before people balk at the idea of %increases to damage at a time when damage is too high - just set the value appropriately, that's all.  

Give the resolve tree some bonuses that actually scale with defensive purchases too.  Make people build tank to tank and build damage to deal damage, and don't let them get the best of both worlds with flat bonuses like they can now.

the thing is you can somewhat. prevent some damage from apcs and such. they aren't gonna lane every skill shot if you play it right. but unfortunately autos are not skill shot. they auto land on you and they do more damage than spells that have actual cooldowns once the adc has 5 items.

NOOOOOOOOO this is not the problem. The problem is literally 1 thing, keystone masteries. The amount of dps you get with fervor and grasp of the undying (and even deathfire and TLD) is absurd. You can take fervor and end up dealing roughly 80 extra damage PER AUTO at the end game while building pretty much full tank. Tanks do not need a nerf, ADC do not need a nerf, masteries need a nerf and/or the champs that specifically abuse grasp and fervor.

I am not saying that I support tank Ekko or a tank Yasuo but I dont either support Miss Fortune who annihilates you with a single ultimate.

As long as Yasuo and Ekko exist, they are going to be incredibly hard to balance and are never going to be fun to play against. Just too many abilities and too many different build paths. The new thing with giving champs enough abilities for 2 champs has to stop.

"But our **_fun and unique_** designs doe!"

No, I agree with you - senselessly overloading just for the sake of uniqueness needed to stop when Thresh was designed...but Riot only wanted more and more and _more._

Its namely multiple effects on several abilities:
Yasuo's abilities have:
Passive: Double crit chance AND a constantly regenerating shield via moving around with level scaling and a 1 second duration when proc'd.
Q: On hit, Critical allowable Short AoE stabs that have low cooldown, gets lower with attack speed AND it has a knock up tornado instead on stab 3.
W: Serves as a omnipotent few second duration directional projectile damage negation for only 'ENEMY' projectiles.
E: Constant dash capability long as a enemy champion or minion is around and he hasn't recently dashed thru it.
R: Supresses knock up targets for 1 second(which can make it extend the knock up to be longer too), Does a butt load of damage and lets Yasuo bypass half the bonus armor on the affected 'enemy champion group' (Not a single surpress and damage nuke, its a AoE affecter so it can hit all 5 enemy champions if done right), plus that bonus armor penetration if i recall would proc at the ability start and it lasts for 15 seconds, if i'm wrong and it procs at the end that still lets yasuo have 15 whole seconds to brutally maim the affected enemy champions, if i'm right then his already big damage ultimate which has a 150% bonus AD scaling is likely ripped apart armored targets up heavily thanks to it during the 'free damage moment on the enemy champions.'

Can you name 1 other champion who has that many effects which include defensive, mobile, offensive and CC abilities, even if you include 'mana and energy champions'? Because likely no other resource or special resource champion has a kit that overloaded.

Some champions might have 1 or 2 abilities with extra effects or extra 'passive effects', but not to the point where it spans to such ridiculous flexibility, that the 'Tank Yasuo' build spawned out because his kit is so overloaded, he can even ignore one of the more ridiculous abilities he has: Double critical hit chance.

Want to know the truth? I think Riot premotes it. 

Not only have they seemingly ignored the concept entirely, But they also designed a new champ who was built FOR this.

They kinda murdered the 'Assassin' role now that every other ADC and it's mom builds AD-Caster items and is basically a ranged Assassin. 

The most obvious solution is to build durability and rely on base stats to take out squishies, hence Tank Assassins - or in other words fighters.

That's what I find incredibly illuminating and also hilarious:

"ADCs do too much damage bc crit!"  The instant ADC finds out it doesn't have to build crit, it stops and starts building like all the other casters: pen stack.  

The reason it's illuminating is that this only became a thing this season and not before.  Why?  Keystones.  Unless we're willing to agree that Riot significantly nerfed the crit build this season to the point that the pen stack became the better option, but I doubt many in this thread are willing to even consider that ADC itemization got nerfed this season.
